ratings.comment: Project Management is definitely Tariq's type of class. Tariq had a great sense of humor, told many interesting stories, and had lots of experience in various areas. The class was low-stress, and I looked forward to attending every day. Thank you, Professor Mughal, for a great experience!
Genuinely the most fun i've ever had in a class. Great professor, great vibes, PHENOMENAL AURA

Tariq is nice and funny, I really want to give him a good review. But at the end of the day, he is not a great professor. At some times, we had to correct him during lecture. He even held a session where walked us through a whole analytics assignment, but I did not get 100% still. Nice guy, not a great professor. Take McClurg, trust.
Tariq was awful, had to drop the class, didn't understand a thing that was going on, bye

His exams are online and use honorlock so you'd assume that it'd be open for a day, but it's only open for a 2 hour window cause he claims he isn't able to put in a time limit in canvas. I had a hectic and unpredictable schedule for the day of the exam and he said he needed the exact time I could take it. Thanks dude I didn't know, thats the idea.

Tariq is a very smart and funny professor. He knows what he is talking about, and gave some memorable lectures. However, the content is very confusing. I really enjoy supply chain, but found some of the content contradictory and over-complicated. The class was confused a majority of the time, and I wish the information was clearer.

If you got a rare question on an exam didn't have typos in it, it still wasn't clear what it was asking. Every assignment was a gamble whether or not you did it right, as questions were unclear and not well-thought out. Lectures were sloppy and unhelpful, as you ended up having to learn it yourself anyway.
Good guy bad professor!

Awful class. Mistakes on the study guide, useless lectures that are mainly rambling and unhelpful practice problems followed by, "you got it?" Very disorganized canvas page, with again, many mistakes on the exam reviews. Even typos on exams. Do not take, bad bad teacher.

Tariq is a great guy, but he is not a good professor at all. He seems to not understand the material, and his lectures were confusing. I had to ask the TA because the professor didn't know the right answer. Overall, this class is relatively easy, with three tests and a few projects, but I recommend taking it with the other professor.

Honestly what most other people said about him is true but I do think he is a very down to earth guy that cares about his students. The class is overall pretty easy with relatively few assignments. Makes a lot of silly references which helped me remember everything. Dont take him if you don't like a talkative professor with some level of random.

Prof. Mughal cares about his students and is a funny guy, but that is about where the good things stop. He is disorganized, never prepared for class, and I am convinced he doesn't actually know the material. It can be frustrating when we have to correct him in class. I can never understand what we are learning because of this. Try to take McClurg.

Nice guy, but a bad professor.  Disorganized and not knowledgeable about the material.  Had to ask students if he was doing an assignment correctly when walking through it during office hours.  For a class that is required for all business majors, the class was not interesting, and the material seemed irrelevant in a general business sense.

Worst professor I have had, this class was awful. He was unprepared for class and did own problems wrong. Discussion problems always wrong. Practice problems had no answer keys. He lacked communication with TAs. Did not respond to emails. Hosted office hours, did not show up. Used Excel in class but would be wrong on the quizzes.

AVOID HIM AT ALL COSTS. Most disorganized employee there could ever be. People cheated on the exams and he didn't care. He lost our exam scores. NEVER answered his emails. I'm not even sure how he got hired. He doesn't teach he actually just plays around in excel. Not a funny guy at all. UW Madison- do better.

Class was frustrating to say the least. Tariq is very funny, but did not know the material he was covering. For the final assignment, he hosted office hours to go through it; however, he made many errors and a few students corrected him 4+ times. In-class problems would be done incorrectly, and he would follow it up by saying 'you get it right?' No

Easily the worst professor I have had at this school. Disorganized, disengaged, and overall, it lead to a very unenjoyable semester. I would avoid taking a class with him at all costs if you care about your education.

I already wrote a 1 star review for him, but I'm writing another because there are countless mistakes on the answer guide for the review problems for the final. If there is any justice in this world he will be fired before he ruins the education of any more students.

Tariq is a nice man, that is about all the good I have to say about him. Prepare for 50-minute lectures full of irrelevant information such as how good "Michigan Ross" is, working in the airline industry, and videos of retro Wendy's commercials instead of finals review. Shame this is a required class where the professor gets his own questions wrong

Lectures are unclear, goes on long tangents in class. Very difficult to learn content other than taking notes of lectures and trying to figure out what formulas mean on you own. Practice problems usually do not have answer keys, making independent learning very difficult. Likes to talk about his time working for United Airlines and Michigan Ross.

Talks about the most random things that have zero to no application to class material/exams. Very hard to study for exams/quizzes as he has no answer keys to many of his problems, especially the hard ones. Said there would be no content on the test about guest speakers and there were questions on them.

Professional yapper.  Avoid Tariq at all costs.  He is the worst professor I have ever had.  Lectures make no sense, he never gets through the slides, never revisits them. Gets his own practice problems wrong in class.  Minimal practice opportunities before graded assignments.  TAs seemed fed up with him as well. Did not follow his syllabus at all.

He is pretty funny, I'll give him that, but I feel like you have to actually be a good professor to be funny in lecture. He is clueless, I went to office hours for help with an assignment and it was clear he had no idea what he was doing and kept making errors. The lecture slides are often messed up and we have the most pointless guest speakers.
He does not know what he's teaching. Wrong about a significant portion of what he teaches each class period.

This class was required so I had no other way around it. Tariq always seems to not be prepared before teaching the class and this is evident when he goes onto the computer to look for something or we are not able to access certain materials on Canvas. Each week gets progressively harder and the content gets so confusing to the point of exhaustion.
